questions.question: ICAO Annex 17 lays down the rules to establish security measures for passengers with regard to:

options.content: cabin baggage, checked baggage, cargo and other goods, access control and airport design.
cabin baggage, checked baggage, cargo and other goods and access control.

questions.question: Except in special cases, the establishment of change-over points shall be limited to route segments of:
Except when cleared by an ATC unit, a VFR flight cannot enter or leave a Control Zone when the cloud base is lower than:

options.content: 1000 ft and less than 8 km visibility.
2000 ft and less than 5 km visibility.
1500 ft or less than 5 km visibility.
1000 ft and less than 5 km visibility.

questions.question: When requesting to engage the parking brake, a marshaller will give the following signal:

options.content: arms repeatedly crossed over the head.
arms placed down and crossed in front of the body moving horizontally.
raise arm and hand with fingers extended horizontally in front of the body. Then clench fist
arms placed horizontally sideways with palms towards the ground beckoning downwards.

questions.question: When doing a procedure turn (45°/180°) going outbound turned 45° off track, the time taken from the beginning of the turn for Cat A and Cat B aircraft is:
Concerning the three entries to the hold, the entry has to be flown on:
When given instructions to set a mode/code, a pilot shall:
In an instrument approach procedure, the segment where the aircraft is lined up with the runway centre line and when the decent is commenced is called:
What does DER mean?
What action should be taken when, during an IFR flight in VMC, you suffer a radio failure?

options.content: Return to the aerodrome from which you departed.
Continue flying in VMC and land as soon as possible.
Maintain your assigned altitude and land at the nearest aerodrome at which there are VMC conditions
Continue flying at your assigned altitude and start your approach at your ETA.

questions.question:
An ATS airspace, in which IFR and VFR flights are permitted and all flights receive air traffic control service;

IFR flights are separated from other IFR flights and receive traffic information concerning VFR flights and VFR flights receive traffic information concerning all other flights, is classified as:
The speed limit (IAS) in airspace E is:

options.content: 250 kt for IFR and VFR, below FL100.
250 kt for IFR only, below FL195.
250 kt for IFR and VFR, at all altitudes.
250 kt for IFR only, below FL100.

questions.question: Who has the final authority as to the disposition of the aircraft?
Who is responsible for the safety of an ATC clearance concerning terrain clearance?

options.content: The ATS reporting point when accepting the flight plan.

questions.question: In Mode 2 Parallel Runway operations, a minimum radar separation can be provided of:

options.content: 3 NM between aircraft on the same localizer course.
2 NM between aircraft on the same localizer course.
3 NM between aircraft on adjacent localizer courses.
5 NM between aircraft on the same localizer course.

questions.question: For a controlled flight before departure, a flight plan must be filed at least:
An aircraft, on a radar approach, should be told to consider making a missed approach when the aircraft is not visible on the radar screen for a significant period of time and when it is within:

options.content: the last 2 NM of the approach.
the last 5 NM of the approach.
the last 4 NM of the approach
the last 3 NM of the approach.

questions.question: Clocks and other timing equipment used by air traffic services must be checked in order to be able to give the time within plus or minus:
In order to satisfy lateral track separation between aircraft using the same fix and Dead Reckoning, the aircraft:

options.content: have to fly 45° separated at a distance of 15 miles or more from the fix.
have to fly 45° separated at a distance of 15 NM or more from the fix.
have to fly 30° separated at a distance of 15 NM or more from the fix.
have to fly 30° separated at a distance of 15 miles or more from the fix.

questions.question: An aircraft making an approach must be told to make a missed approach, when no landing clearance has been received from the non-radar traffic controller, when the aircraft is at a distance of:

Temporary changes of long duration in specifications for AIP supplements and information of short duration, which contains extensive text and / or graphical representation, has to be published as AIP supplements. Long duration is considered to be:
How many red lights have to be seen by the pilot, whose aircraft on final approach follows a normal PAPI defined glide-path?
A clearway is a squared area that is established to:

options.content: protect aircraft during take-off and landing.
enable the aircraft to stop in the case of an aborted take-off.
enable the aircraft to make a part of the initial climb to a specified altitude.
decrease the risk of damage to aircraft which run off the end of the runway.

questions.question:
It says in the annex of the ICAO convention that the sizes of airfields are specified by codes for different runways

What is the minimum width of a runway with runway code 4?
When someone’s admittance to a country is refused and he/she is brought back to the operator for transportation away from the territory of the state:

options.content: the operator will not take any transportation costs from the passenger which arise from his/her inadmissibility.
the operator is not responsible for that person, to whom the admittance to the host country is refused.
the operator and state of the operator are both responsible for the refused person.
the operator will not be prevented from taking any transport costs from a person which arises out of his/her inadmissibility.

questions.question: An aircraft which is not concerned with regular international flights and which makes a flight to or via a dedicated aerodrome of a member State and is temporarily free of taxes is admitted and will stay within that State without paying customs:

options.content: during a period which is determined by the State.

questions.question:
An aircraft flies over mountainous terrain at which a search and rescue operation is conducted to find survivors of a plane crash.

The pilot sees a ground sign in the form of an “X”. This indicates:
A controlled flight is required to inform the concerned ATC unit when the average TAS at cruising level deviates or is expected to deviate compare in the Flight Plan by at least plus or minus:
Concerning aircraft registration markings, no combinations can be used if they can be mistaken for:

options.content: codes which are used for identification of ICAO documents.
3 letter combinations which are used by international code of signals.
5 letter combinations which are used by international code of signals.

questions.question: What is the rule concerning level or height the aircraft should maintain when flying IFR outside controlled airspace unless otherwise directed?

options.content: 2000 ft above the highest obstacle within 8 km of the heading.
1000 ft above the highest obstacle within 8 km of the estimated position of the aircraft.
1000 ft above the highest obstacle within 8 NM of the planned track.
2000 ft above the highest obstacle within 8 NM of the planned track.

questions.question: An aircraft is expected to overtake another aircraft if it is closing from behind in a sector of:

options.content: 50° both sides of the longitudinal axis.
60° both sides of the longitudinal axis.
80° both sides of the longitudinal axis.
70° both sides of the longitudinal axis.

questions.question: Aircraft A flies in VMC with an ATC clearance within a control area. Aircraft  without ATC clearance approaches at roughly the same height on a converging heading. Who has right of way?

options.content: Aircraft A, regardless of the direction from which B approaches.
Aircraft B, regardless of the direction from which A approaches
Aircraft A, if B is to the right of him.
Aircraft B, if A is to the left of him.

questions.question: The person having overall responsibility of an aircraft during flight is the:

options.content: ATC Controller if the aircraft is in controlled airspace.

questions.question: Pilots are not allowed to use the ident function on their SSR, unless:

options.content: they operate a transponder with mode C.

questions.question: Transition Level:

options.content: is published on every approach and landing chart for every airfield.
will be calculated by the pilot-in-command.
will be calculated by the ATC service of an ATS unit.

questions.question:
It is permitted in a particular sector, if there is a conspicuous obstacle in the visual manoeuvring area outside the final and missed approach areas, to disregard that obstacle

When using this option, the published procedure shall be:

options.content: circling is only permitted in VMC.
recommended not to execute a circling approach in the entire sector in which the obstacle is situated.
prohibit a circling approach for the concerned runway.
forbid a circling approach in the entire sector in which the obstacle is located.

questions.question: If the track on an instrument departure is published, the pilot is expected to:

options.content: correct for the known wind so as to maintain the published track.
ask ATC for another heading to steer correcting for wind.
ignore the wind and proceed with a heading equal to the track.
ask ATC for permission to correct heading for wind.

questions.question: Close to an aerodrome that will be used for landing by aircraft, the vertical position shall be expressed as:

options.content: altitude above sea level on or above transition altitude.
flight level on or under the transition altitude.
flight level on or under the transition level.
altitude above sea level at or below transition altitude.

questions.question: A manoeuvre where a turn is made from a “designated track” followed by a turn in the opposite direction to enable the aircraft to fly the prescribed track is called a:
The transition from altitude to flight level and visa versa is made:

options.content: on the transition level in the climb and transition altitude in the descent.
at the transition altitude in the climb and transition level in the descent.

questions.question: Lights on an airfield or in the vicinity can be extinguished if they can be re-lit:

options.content: at least 5 minutes before the ETA of the aircraft.
at least 15 minutes before the ETA of the aircraft.
at least 30 minutes before the ETA of the aircraft.
at least 60 minutes before the ETA of the aircraft.

questions.question: Air Traffic Service unit consists of:

options.content: Air Traffic Control Units and Flight Information Centres.
Flight Information Centres and Air Services Reporting offices.
Air Traffic Control Units, Flight Information Centres and Air Traffic Services Reporting offices.
Air Services Reporting offices and Air Traffic Control Units.

questions.question:
An aircraft is maintaining FL150 in Class C Airspace. Another aircraft below at FL140 receives a clearance to descend to FL70.

There is severe turbulence in the area.

When at earliest can a clearance be expected to descend to FL140 or lower?

options.content: When the other aircraft has reported to be descending through FL130.
When the other aircraft has reported to have left FL120.
When the other aircraft has reported to have left FL140.
When the other aircraft has reached FL70.

questions.question: When the captain cannot comply with an ATC clearance:

options.content: the Captain must accept the ATC clearance, because it is based on a filed flight plan.
he/she may request an amended clearance and, if executable, he/she will accept that clearance
he/she may ask for a new clearance and the appropriate ATC must grant him/ her that clearance
he/she may suggest a new clearance to ATC.

questions.question: The transition from IFR to VFR is done:

options.content: whenever an aircraft in VMC leaves controlled airspace.
at the clearance limit, disregarding the weather situation.

questions.question: According to international agreements the wind direction must be given in degrees magnetic converted with local magnetic variation from the true wind direction:

options.content: before landing and taxi for take-off.
in anticipation of the upper wind for areas North of 60° N and South of 60° S.
when an aircraft is requested by the meteorological office or on specified points to give a PIREP.
when the local variation is greater than 10° East or West.

questions.question:
The longitudinal separation minimum based on time between aircraft at the same FL,

where there is enough coverage for navigation aids and the preceding aircraft has a higher true airspeed of 20 kt minimum is:

When independent parallel approaches are used on parallel runways and headings (vectors) are given to intercept the ILS,

the given heading must be such that the aeroplane can establish on the localizer course or the MLS final approach track in level flight over at least:

options.content: 2.5 NM before the ILS glide slope or the specified MLS elevation angle is intercepted.
1.5 NM before the ILS glide slope or the specified MLS elevation angle is intercepted
3.0 NM before the ILS glide slope or the specified MLS elevation angle is intercepted
2.0 NM before the ILS glide slope or the specified MLS elevation angle is intercepted.

questions.question: What is the length of the approach lighting system of a Cat II precision landing runway?
A PAPI must consist of:

options.content: a row of 4 multiple lights or paired units without transition zone, at equal distance from each other.
two rows of 4 multiple lights or paired units without transition zone, at equal distance from each other
a row of 2 multiple lights or paired units without transition zone, at equal distance from each other
two rows of 6 multiple lights or paired units without transition zone, at equal distance from each other

questions.question: Lights at the end of the runway shall be:

options.content: steady unidirectional lights radiating white light in the direction of the runway.
steady white lights with controllable intensity
steady omni-directional red lights with controllable intensity.
steady unidirectional lights radiating red light in the direction of the runway.

questions.question: An aircraft is allowed to descend below the MSA if:

options.content: the pilot follows the published approach procedures.
the pilot has visual contact with the runway and surrounding terrain and is able to maintain visual contact

questions.question: Repetitive flight plans (RPLs) cannot be used for flights other than those executed frequently on the same days of following weeks and:

options.content: for at least 20 occasions or every day over a period of at least 20 consecutive days.
for at least 10 occasions or every day over a period of at least 10 consecutive days.

questions.question: The VMC minima for a VFR flight within ATS airspace class B are:

options.content: 8 km visibility at or above 3050 m AMSL and clear of cloud.
5 NM visibility at or above 3050 m AMSL, 1500 m horizontal and 300 m vertical clear of cloud
8 km visibility at or above 3050 m AMSL, 1500 m horizontal and 300 m vertical clear of cloud.
5 NM visibility at or above 3050 m AMSL and clear of cloud.

questions.question: The minimum response time for the aerodrome rescue and fire fighting services to the end of each runway as well as to any other part of the movement area is:
The minimum number of rescue and fire fighting vehicles required for a Cat 8 Aerodrome is:

options.content: None of the above is correct.

questions.question: A fixed obstacle that extends above a take-off climb surface within _____ shall be marked and, if the runway is to be used at night, must be lit.
A marshaller crosses his/her hands in front of the face, palms outwards and then moves the arms outwards. What does this signal indicate?
What is required for an IFR flight in advisory airspace?

options.content: Flight plan required and PIC must notify of any changes regardless if wanting advisory service or not.
Flight plan required but PIC need not notify of any changes.
A flight plan is only required if advisory service is required

questions.question: What is the separation that must be maintained before intercepting the ILS on an independent parallel approach?
A Type Rating is applicable to:

options.content: an aircraft requiring a Certificate of Airworthiness.
an aircraft with a Certificate of Airworthiness issued by the State.
an aircraft that requires multi-pilot operation.
an aircraft that requires additional skills training.

questions.question: If an aircraft is radar vectored to intercept an ILS localizer, what is the maximum intercept angle?
What are the objectives of ATC Services?

options.content: To prevent collisions between aircraft, to prevent collisions between aircraft on the manoeuvring area and obstructions on that area and to expedite and maintain an orderly flow of air traffic.
To prevent collisions between controlled aircraft and to expedite and maintain an orderly flow of air traffic
To provide separation of aircraft and to expedite and maintain an orderly flow of air traffic
To provide separation of controlled aircraft and to expedite and maintain an orderly flow of air traffic

questions.question:
Temporary changes of long duration (3 months or more) and information of short duration which contains extensive graphics and/or text are published as AIP Supplements.

Check lists of these Supplements which are in force are sent to recipients at intervals of not more than:
A check list of AIP Supplements is published:

A heavy aircraft makes a missed approach on a parallel runway in the opposite direction. A light aircraft has a wake turbulence separation of 2 minutes.

This wake turbulence separation will apply when the parallel runways are:
A TODA consists of:

options.content: the take-off run available excluding the clearway.
the take-off run available including the clearway.
the take-off run available excluding the stopway.

questions.question: The continued validity of a C of A of an aircraft is subject to the laws of:

options.content: the State of Registration and the State of the Operator.
the State of Registry and the State of Design.

questions.question: ATIS will only broadcast cloud base information when the cloud base is:

options.content: when the cloud base is below MSA.

questions.question: Which International Agreement relates to Penal Law?

Voice ATIS:

1. cannot be broadcast on a voice ILS.

2. cannot be broadcast on voice VOR.

3. is broadcast only on a discreet VFH frequency.

4. is broadcast on either a discreet VFH, VOR or an ILS frequency.
The operator is responsible for the custody and care of the passengers. This responsibility shall terminate:

options.content: from the moment they have been cleared through customs of the destination State
from the moment they step from the aircraft onto the passenger exit stairs
from the moment they have been admitted into the destination State
from the moment they step from the aircraft onto the ground of the destination State

questions.question: Fixed distance markers, when provided, shall commence:

options.content: 300 metres from the far end threshold
150 metres from the far end threshold

questions.question: What is the minimum width of a code 4 runway?
What is the width of a code letter D taxiway used by aircraft with an outer gear wheel span of more than 9 m ?
What is the meaning of the signal LLL from search parties?

options.content: We have only found some personnel.

questions.question: An RNP1 route designated as A342Z, indicates that the route is at or below FL190 and all turns shall be made within the allowable RNP tolerance of a tangential arc between the straight leg segments with a radius of:

An RNP1 route designated as A342Y, indicates that the route is at or above FL200 and all turns shall be made within the allowable RNP tolerance of a tangential arc between the straight leg segments with a radius of:
If no ICAO identifier has been attributed to an aerodrome, what should be entered in Box 16 of the Flight Plan?
Which of the following is not a valid SSR mode A squawk?

A separation minima shall be applied between a light or medium aircraft and a heavy and between a light and a medium aircraft when the heavier aircraft is making a low or missed approach and the lighter aircraft is utilizing an opposite direction runway on a parallel runway separated by:

A contracting state which continues to require the presentation of a cargo manifest shall, apart from the information indicated in the heading of the format of the cargo manifest, not require more than the following items:

options.content: airway bill number, and the number of packages only.
total weight and the number of packages only.
total weight and the nature of the goods only.
airway bill number, the number of packages and the nature of goods.

questions.question: Contracting states shall carry out the handling, forwarding and clearance of airmail and shall comply with the documentary procedures as prescribed by:

options.content: the Acts in force of the Universal Postal Union.
the Acts in force of the General Postal Union
the Acts in force of the Warsaw Convention
the Acts in force of the International Postal Union.

questions.question: Unaccompanied baggage carried by air shall be cleared under a procedure applicable to:

options.content: accompanied baggage or under a simplified customs procedure distinct and different from that normally applicable to other cargo.

questions.question: An area symmetrical about the extended runway centre line and adjacent to the end of the strip, primarily intended to reduce the risk of damage to an aircraft undershooting or overrunning the runway is defined as a:
For an instrument runway, how far from the centre line of the runway is a “runway vacated” sign positioned?

options.content: To a distance of the nearest Pattern ‘A’ holding position.
At the end of the ILS/MLS Sensitive Area.
It depends on the Aerodrome Category

questions.question: What is required if a stop bar is not provided at a runway entrance and the runway is to be used with RVR of less than 550 m?

options.content: Both a Pattern ‘A’ and ‘B’ holding position.
High intensity taxiway centreline lights only
Both high intensity taxiway centre line lights and high intensity taxiway edge lights.

questions.question: Independent parallel approaches may be conducted to parallel runways provided that an NTZ of at least:

options.content: 915 m is established between extended centre lines.
760 m is established between extended centre lines.
1035 m is established between extended centre lines.
610 m wide is established between extended centre lines.

questions.question: ATIS broadcasts contain cloud details whenever the:

options.content: Cloud ceiling is below 5000 ft or the highest MSA (whichever is the higher)
Cloud base is below 5000 ft or the highest MSA (whichever is the higher)
Cloud ceiling is below 1500 ft or the highest MSA (whichever is the higher)
Cloud base is below 1500 ft or the highest MSA (whichever is the higher)

questions.question: What action should be taken if contact is lost with the runway during a circling approach?

options.content: Descend to Decision Height and if still no contact with the runway, initiate a missed approach

questions.question: The State of registration is:

options.content: The State where the aircraft is first registered
The State where the aircraft is currently registered
The State where the aircraft is finally assembled
The State of the owner of the aircraft

questions.question: When an aircraft subjected to unlawful interference has landed in a Contracting State, it shall notify by the most expeditious means the State of Registry and the State of the Operator of the landing and, in addition, shall similarly transmit all other relevant information to:

options.content: each State whose citizens suffered fatalities or injuries, each State whose citizens were detained as hostages, each State whose citizens were known to be on board and ICAO.
each State whose citizens were known to be on board only.
ICAO and each State whose citizens were known to be on board only.

questions.question: According to JAR-FCL1, recognized instructor categories are:

options.content: FI(A), TRI(A), CRI(A), IRI(A), MCCI(A) and SFI(A) only.

questions.question: When a State renders valid a licence issued by another Contracting State, as an alternative to issuance of its own licence, the validity shall:

options.content: not extend beyond 15 days after the validity of the licence.
not extend beyond the period of validity of the licence.
be at the discretion of the Contracting State rendering it valid.
be at the discretion of ICAO.

questions.question: Where in the AIP would you find details on instrument holding procedures?
In the event of a delay of a controlled flight, the flight plan shall be amended or cancelled and a new flight plan submitted should that delay be in excess of:

options.content: 60 mins of estimated time of ETD
30 mins of estimated time of ETD

questions.question: The International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) establishes:

options.content: standards and recommended international practices for contracting member states.
aeronautical standards adopted by all states.
proposals for aeronautical regulations in the form of 18 annexes
standards and recommended practices applied without exception by all states, signatory to the Chicago convention

questions.question: According to Annex 7, the registration mark shall be letters, numbers or a combination of letters and numbers and shall be that assigned by:

options.content: the State of Registry or Common Mark Registering Authority.

questions.question: According to JAR-FCL, the privileges of the holder of an unrestricted FI(A) rating are to conduct flight instruction for the issue of a CPL(A):

options.content: provided that the FI(A) has completed not less than 15 hours on the relevant type in the preceding 12 months.
provided that the FI(A) has completed at least 500 hours of flight time as a pilot of aeroplanes including at least 200 hours of flight instruction.
provided that the FI(A) has completed 200 hours of flight instruction.

questions.question: According to JAR-FCL, an applicant for a CPL (A) who has satisfactorily followed and completed an integrated flying training course shall have completed as a pilot of aeroplanes having a certificate of airworthiness issued or accepted by an EASA Member State at least:

options.content: 150 hours of flight time plus 10 hours of instrument ground time.
200 hours of flight time plus 10 hours of instrument ground time.

questions.question: If radio communication is established during an interception but communications in a common language is not possible, which phrase should be pronounced by the intercepting aircraft to request the intercepted aircraft to descend for landing?
An aircraft manoeuvring in an airport’s circuit receives a series of red flashes from the control tower. This signifies that the aircraft must:

options.content: not land because the airport is not available for landing.
return to land and that clearance to land will be communicated in due course.
not land for the moment regardless of previous instructions.

questions.question: Which action shall be taken by an aircraft in the traffic pattern of an aerodrome, experiencing radio failure to indicate difficulties which compel it to land without requiring immediate assistance?

options.content: Switching on and off three times the landing lights
The repeated switching on and off of the landing lights.
Switching on and off four times the navigation lights.
Switching on and off four times the landing lights

questions.question: The main factor/s that dictate/s in general the design of an instrument departure procedure is/are:

options.content: airspace restrictions applicable and in force.

questions.question: One of the conditions to descent below the MDA on a circling approach is:

options.content: the landing runway and an alternative landing possibility (runway) are in sight.
the required visual references have been established and can be maintained.
the ceiling is 1500 ft or higher
the horizontal visibility is at least 5 NM and the ceiling is 1500 ft or higher.

questions.question: If for any reasons a pilot is unable to conform to the procedures for normal conditions laid down for any particular holding pattern, he should:

options.content: advise ATC as early as possible.
execute a non-standard holding pattern in accordance with the performance of his aeroplane
remain within the protected area, but may deviate from the prescribed holding
follow the radio communication failure procedure.

questions.question: The Transition Level:

options.content: shall be the lowest flight level available for use above the transition altitude.
shall be the highest available flight level below the transition altitude that has been established
is published for the aerodrome in the Section ENR of the AIP.
is calculated and declared for an approach by the pilot-in-command.

questions.question: When the aircraft carries a serviceable Mode C transponder, the pilot shall continuously operate this mode:

options.content: only when the aircraft is flying within controlled airspace.

questions.question: The speed limitation for VFR flights inside ATS airspace classified as C, when flying below 3050 m (10 000 ft) AMSL, is:
The VMC minima for a VFR flight inside an ATS airspace classified as B, is:

options.content: 5 NM visibility below 3050 m (10 000 ft) AMSL, clear of clouds.
5 NM visibility when below 3050 m (10 000 ft) AMSL, 1500 m horizontal and 300 m vertical from cloud.
8 km visibility when at or above 3050 m (10 000 ft) AMSL and clear of clouds.
8 km visibility when at or above 3050 m (10 000 ft) AMSL, and 1500 m horizontal and 300 m vertical from clouds.

questions.question: Area Control Centres issue clearances for the purpose of:
FIS is provided to aircraft within:

options.content: Classes A, B, C, D, E, F & G classes of airspace
Classes C, D, E, F & G classes of airspace only
Classes F & G classes of airspace only
Classes A, B, C, D & E classes of airspace only

questions.question: The Vertical Separation Minimum (VSM) for flights in accordance with IFR within controlled airspace below FL290 is:

The “Clearance to fly maintaining own separation while in visual meteorological conditions” may be given by the appropriate ATS authority.

This has to be requested by the pilot of a controlled flight and has to be agreed by the pilot of the other aircraft.

The conditions are:

options.content: Airspace Class C, VMC, hours of daylight.
Airspace Class D and E, VMC, hours of daylight.
Airspace Class B. C, D and E, VMC

questions.question: For controlled traffic that shall be separated in the vicinity of an airport, separation minima may be reduced:

options.content: if the commander of the involved aircraft so requests.
only if the air traffic controller has the involved aircraft in sight
when the commander in the following aircraft has the preceding aircraft in sight and is able to maintain own separation
at the discretion of the air traffic controller

questions.question:
In order to meet the wake turbulence criteria,

what minimum separation should be applied when a medium aircraft is taking off behind a heavy aircraft and both are using the same runway?
Which does ATC Term “Radar contact” signify?

options.content: Your aircraft has been identified on the radar display and radar flight instructions will be provided until radar identification is terminated.
Your aircraft has been identified and you will receive separation from all aircraft while in contact with this radar facility.
You will be given traffic advisories until advised that the service has been terminated or that radar contact has been lost.
ATC is receiving your transponder and will furnish vectors and traffic advisories until you are advised that contact has been lost.

questions.question: When the transponder appears to be unserviceable prior to departure and restore is impossible, then:

options.content: you must indicate the failure in the fight plan, after which the ATC will endeavour to provide for continuation of the flight
departure to the nearest suitable airport where repair can be effected is allowed.
you are not allowed to commence the flight.
the flight can only continue in the most direct manner.

questions.question: The publication containing information concerning general flight safety, technical, administrational of legislative ammeters of a state is called:
Which part of the AIP contains a list with “Location Indicators”?
Which “code letter” shall be chosen to identify a taxiway to be used by an aircraft having a wheel base of 15 m?
In a precision approach category I lighting system, the single, two and three light sources on the centre line have a length of:
When a person is found inadmissible and is returned to the operator for transport away from the territory of the state, the operator:

options.content: shall not be precluded from recovering from such person any transportation costs arising from his (her) inadmissibility
shall not recover from such person any transportation costs arising from his (her) inadmissibility
is not responsible for the person inadmissible for entry in the receiving state.
the state of the operator are both responsible for the person inadmissible.

questions.question: Who is responsible for the initiation of an accident investigation?

options.content: The Authority of the State in which the accident took place.
The Operators of the same aircraft type.
The State of design and manufacturer.

questions.question: When it becomes apparent that an aircraft is in difficulty, the decision to initiate the alert phases is the responsibility of the:
An aircraft intercepted by a military aircraft shall immediately attempt to establish radio communication with the intercepting aircraft on the following frequencies:

options.content: 121.5 MHz, and if communications cannot be established, on 243.0 MHz.
121.5 MHz, and if communications cannot be established, on 406.0 MHz.
121.5 MHz, and if communications cannot be established, on 282.0 MHz
243.0 MHz, and if communications cannot be established, on 121.5 MHz.

questions.question: What are the differences between the rules and regulations in the UIR compared with the airspace below?

options.content: They are agreed by the Air Navigation Meeting.
They are identical to the airspace below.
They do not have to be identical to the airspace below.

questions.question: What is the distance normally associated with VOR change-over points?

The body, which governs licensing of pilot licences or the equivalent documents, must decide if the experience of the pilot in training done on a simulator is acceptable as part of the total flying time of 1500 hours. Exemption from such experience shall be limited to a maximum of:

options.content: 100 hours, of which not more than 15 hours may be done on a flight procedure trainer or a synthetic flight trainer
75 hours, of which not more than 20 hours may be done on a flight procedure trainer or a synthetic flight trainer
100 hours, of which not more than 20 hours may be done on a synthetic flight trainer.
100 hours, of which not more than 25 hours may be done on a flight procedure trainer or a basic instrument flight trainer.

questions.question: A Repetitive Flight Plan may be submitted by an Operator when a flight is operated on:

options.content: the same day(s) of consecutive weeks and on at least 5 occasions
every day over a period of at least 5 consecutive days
every day over a period of at least 5 consecutive days but not more than 10 consecutive days
the same day(s) of consecutive weeks and on at least 10 occasions

questions.question: What are the characteristics of Intermediate Holding Position lights ?

options.content: A flashing red light showing in the direction of the taxiing aircraft
Traffic lights showing green for “go” and red for “stop”

questions.question: What are the characteristics of Runway Threshold Identification lights ?

options.content: Flashing yellow lights unidirectional in the direction of the approach to the runway
Flashing white lights unidirectional in the direction of the approach to the runway
Steady omni-directional green lights augmenting the runway threshold lights
Low intensity steady white lights placed between each green runway threshold light

questions.question: Which EU directive is the equivalent of ICAO Annex 13 ?
What is the speed limit for IFR flight operating in Class C airspace ?
Unaccompanied baggage:

options.content: shall be treated as cargo but processed using a simplified procedure
may, in exceptional circumstances, be carried in the passenger compartment
may be kept in the transit area for a maximum of 2 days
must be capable of being opened without damage to the baggage

questions.question: For a controlled flight, the flight plan shall be amended or cancelled and a new flight plan submitted, should there be a delay of :

options.content: I hour in excess of EOB (off blocks time)
30 minutes in excess of EOB (off blocks time)
In excess of 1 hour of ETD entered in the Flight Plan
In excess of 30 minutes of ETD entered in the Flight Plan

What is RTR?

Road Holding Position lights may take the form of:
VOR change-over points should be every
Who is responsible for the costs of returning deportees?
By what method is an AIRPROX(P) first filed?

options.content: By submission of a completed AIRPROX form (APX 452) by the Operator
By the fastest method by the Controller
By submission of a completed AIRPROX form (APX 500) by the Operator

questions.question: What is the minimum visibility for a VM(C) approach in the case of a category B aircraft ?
An aircraft has a V<sub>S1g</sub> of 90 kt. What is its category?
An aircraft has suffered severe damage to a tyre. Is this an accident?

options.content: No, but ICAO must be informed
It depends whether or not the aircraft was moving at the time

questions.question: ATIS broadcasts should contain cloud details, when:

options.content: they are below 5000 ft or MSA, whichever is the higher.
they are below 1000 m or MSA, whichever is the greater.

questions.question: The State that registers an aircraft for the first time must inform:
ICAO is to be notified of any accident or serious incident involving an aircraft with a maximum mass of:
A serious injury is an injury which is sustained by a person in an accident and which :

options.content: requires hospitalization for 48 hours or more
requires hospitalization for 24 hours or more
requires hospitalization for more than 24 hours
requires hospitalization for more than 48 hours
